text:
Broadway, west side, from 22nd (left) to 23rd (right) streets, showing a side of the triangular plot formed by the convergence of this thoroughfare with Fifth Ave. The latter appears across the roofs of the low buildings on the right. This site will be improved with the distinctive Fuller (Flatiron) Building of 1902. The structure that bears the Heinz sign is the old Hotel St. Germain of 1855. To the right is an office building at the S.W. corner of Fifth Avenue and West 22nd Street.

About 1900

H.W. Tiemann, photo
Gift of l/rbrook Collection
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

Neg. # 1518

Broadway (right) at the S.E. corner of East 22nd Street, showing the former Brooks Brothers Building under renovation. This structure has remained idle for years and will shortly present a modern appearance. For a fuller account see either the New York Sun or Times of March
1938.
November 11, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
